text: there are two sides of Nairobi one side
has big buildings shopping malls
all-you-can-eat meet buffets and trendy
rooftop Bars the other side is called
Kabira Tiberio is a district of Nairobi
that is considered to be the biggest
slum in Africa more than 1 million
people live within 2 square kilometres 1
million people 2 square kilometers it's
a place where people drink water out of
rivers full of trash and human feces our
community is city of honorable water is
viscous where people live and scrap
together shacks made of mud turn by
trans grille and where residents
struggle to earn a dollar a day but just
like I've seen in Mumbai's Dharavi and
Manila Sun hundra's bukit slum areas
Tiberio is a beautiful place if you dig
deeper in the few hours i spent here
this morning i saw nothing but smiling
faces people eager to shake my hand and
say hello kids laughing and playing
soccer with empty water bottles no harm
no hostility
[Music]
Kabira is a production madhouse with
every type of service and market
existing within a two kilometer boundary
we are walking now on the railroad track
which kind of cuts the whole division in
half and to my knowledge it's still
working
hard-working people hustling to sell you
anything it's like a city within a city
very well-behaved kids I'm very
impressed yes it may be sad to witness
such extreme poverty but you would be
surprised by how happy the people are in
their home community they don't know
about a different life they only know
what happens inside these walls we just
see their lives through a different lens
the moral of the story is happiness and
love are the keys to life and both of
those things exist right here in Kabira
I'm driven ski and if you like my videos
please click Subscribe and join me as I
plan to visit every country in the world
